text:
Bottle at Craigs cons 2017- 06-17 Edinburgh
AR: herbal spices, woody
AP: soapy yellow, no head
F: malty, herbal/spices, apricot, sweetnees

Sample courtesy of cgarvieuk dregs run. 
Appearance - golden yellow. 
Nose - a well as honey am definitely getting the cinnamon. 
Taste - apple and cinnamon confirmed. 
Palate - full bodied and sweet throughout. 
Overall - liquid apple strudel.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours very pale, clear golden. Nose is cloves and cinnamon, honey. Tastes cinnamon, honey, and cloves as well. A bit too.. christmasy.. Good anyway.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear yellow with no head. Aromas of cinnamon, clove, aniseed, honey. Taste is light sweet. Lots of clove.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear golden, nose is clove, aniseed, honey, taste is juicy sweet honey, spiced.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 bottle at home .. golden ... thin white lacing ... soft dry honey ... light heather fruit ... big cloves nose... massive cloev front .. soft honey ... ligth orange .. juicty honey fruit .. but massive cloves

tk 2... cloves say it all ...

HB thanks to Paul from a bottle thanks to Paul. Cheers Paolo. It pours a perfectly clear yellow color with no head. Aroma is sweet and lightly floral with notes of honey, melon, light spices, clove. Taste is spicy and herbal on a big sweet base. More notes of honey, clove, black pepper. Full bodied with quasi-flat carbonation. Overall, interesting mead

Bottle at The High WyCum tasting, Chez Bois, thanks to Scopeye 05/11/16. 
Pale golden yellow with nothing in the way of a head.
Nose is sweet fruits, vanilla, plum duff, figs, custard, caramel melt.
Taste comprises light spice, vanilla, clove, fruit esters, nana melt, medicinal tones.
Full bodied, cloying, sweet boosty close.
Decent enough mead.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at the hi wy cum. Tasting, 5/11/2016. Huge thanks to to Paul for this one. Aroma is big star anise, liquorice, spices, Christmas, little woody. . Palate is medium sweet and full lowish carbonation. Flavour is composed of sweet honey, pear and apple, bug Christmas spices, sweet and liquorice. . Really good.

Bottle shared at Colins. it pours clear pale gold with no head. The aroma is rich, spiced, clove, cinnamon, warming, candy, honeycomb, honey cake, light menthol and vanilla. The taste is rich, slick, honey cake, juicy, festive spice, clove, cinnamon, apple pie, pear, cake and very little alcohol with a smooth finish. Medium + body and slick mouth - feel. Works rather well.

Bottle shared in High Wycombe - thanks to Scoopy. Pours clear yellow-gold. The aroma has some spices, menthol, clove, cinnamon. Heavy sweet flavour with more spice character, gooey honey, white sugar. Full bodied, oily and chewy. Lightly warming finish with nips of ripe apple, more spices, cinnamon sticks, clove, honey. Fun beer. Very, very festive.

750ml bottle. Pale yellow gold colour, no head, and with a spicy, incense & honey aroma. Taste is mellow honey, nectar sweet, apple, cinnamon spice, woody herby, earthy & grassy. Syrupy mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, clean warmish spicy finish. Nicely sippable, gets better with each sip.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 March 2016 - Sampled from bottle at The Beer Boutique, Putney. As Mabinogion Mead - Transformation to Eagle, 15%. Pale yellow, still, clear, no head. Aroma is mostly clove sweets, woody with some light pot pourri. Body is a little light, smooth. Taste is sweet, as expected. A nice balance between the honey and apple, more clove, lightly woody finish. Quite well balanced. Strong medicinal clove and incense vibe. Interesting. Again, its a bit sweet and one-dimensional for my taste but I can see why people really like it. (3.5)
November 2016 - Bottle share at Theydons High Wycombe Tasting.  Thanks Paul! Clove mouthwash, honey, clove sweets.  Nice enough. Same impression. (3.5)
This is a truly amazing spiced mead. Absolutely smooth with no off flavors. The balance of honey, spice and alcohol is superb.
Absolutely amazing traditional mead, A golden coloured cyser with a thin lacing and a sweet apple spicey finish.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2016 Sample tried thanks to Ceara @ Mab Mead.
Delicate woodesque aroma with a light flower blossom character and restrained sweetness. Really beautiful. Clear vibrant but light yellow in colour with a slightly thicker viscosity than water.
Wow! The flavour begins with an aromatic peppery warmth and continues on to elicit wood like and finally cinnamon stick flavours. Absolutely astounding and by far the best mead I have ever tasted! In the interest of balance I must admit that there is one slight flavour lurking which I am not sure of, but it is a soft one and hardly detectable - very slightly chloric - or perhaps better described as medicinal. Possibly the interplay of the many flavours creating an illusion. This is very possible as the flavour is morphing, Im just blown away by all of these unbelievable flavours! The sweetness is a perfect level.
While the scent is at first too sweet, the flavour is robust from sip to sip. Warming on the palate, the flavour lingers. Can truly taste the wildness of the apples in this cyser.

What a splendid example of a spiced cyser. Color is a bright rose crystal clear, aroma is warm cinnamon with well balanced floral honey. The drinkability is wonderful and cinnamon is calm and balanced with a semi sweet mouth feel and medium body that finishes dry but fruity. Very pleased with this mead looking foreword to what they will create next.

First impression from the aroma: Wow! Subtle honey with enticing spice and pleasant nuances. Perfect balance of flavor between all the competing profiles. Ive never imbibed on a more elegant spiced mead. Im so lucky to have tasted this concoction. Once in a lifetime batch.

This is an outstanding mead. The brilliantly clear golden color yields an aroma of fall spice that is evident in the flavors of honey, Apple and spice. Truly one of the best meads Ive had in some time.
Delicious! Great clarity and aroma. Cinnamon, apple, and honey on the nose. An exceptional spiced cyser.
Sweet apple and cinnomon on the nose with a straw pale colour. Great alcohol depth and nice honey sweetness. smooth and winter spice balance

Aroma is quite sweet, but lets you know what you are getting into.

Although the sweet and apple was a bitch much for me, the spicing rounded it out. Was happy with the initially light mouthfeel, though this gets stronger and lingers as you continue to sip the drink.

Very beautiful colour, pours softly, and fun design.

Just what I was expecting from my first mead, so very happy overall.

A truly beautiful golden colour, this absolutely looks like proper mead.

Not as sicky sweet as many meads can be, and far from a liqueur. Easy drinking and a good way to have my friends try a new drink.

A light taste made it easy to sip all night, but the strong scent wafted through the room whenever it was poured. 

Nice and appley, this went well with Christmas ham, but the cinnamon undertones made it appropriate for pudding as well. 

After three or four sips, the flavour really settled on the tongue. The profile is much deeper and rich than the initial taster makes it to be.

Will consider as a warm weather staple, as the fruity aspect kept it light.
